result.execSummary:
The defendant Zekia C. Hodgson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant to pay restitution due to Stockman's supply first, to be paid in full within the first 8 months of probation.  Restitution to be paid on a regular monthly basis on a plan set up by her agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment, when agent deems it appropriate.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Submit to mental health evaluation and comply with recommendations, if agent deems appropriate.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Dawn Anderson, Jennifer Lafernier, Nicholas Thorson, Charles Singer or the victim.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend CGIP per agent's recommendation.

Defendant shall be subject to random drug testing.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

of JOC.  RTS.  No such Number.  UTF.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser. Victim notification complied with.   Plead no contest to Counts 1 and 7.   Court recited the charges and the possible penalties of those charges.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated as to a factual basis for the charges.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty Counts 1 and 7.  Counts 2- 6 in this case, and Trempealeau County Case No. 15CM44 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.  Restitution to Fed Coop and CCU.  $1358.25.  (Rest. in Tremp Co. $468.37.  Stockman's in Osseo.  Pay within the first 8 months probation.)    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 45 day jail sentence imposed and stayed on the condition she comply with probation conditions.  AODA  Seek and maintain employment.  No contact with Dawn Anderson, Jennifer Lafernier, Nicholas Thorson or the victim K.L.   CGIP.  Mental health evaluation and comply with recommendations.   Defendant did not elect to exercise her right to allocution.    

Court questioned defendant on her ability to proceed.  She says she wants to proceed.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  Restitution to Federation Cooperative and Coop Credit Union.  Jackson County restitution total $1358.25.  (Rest. in Tremp Co. $468.37.  Stockman's in Osseo.  Pay within the first 8 months probation.)    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Random drug testing by her agent.  45 day jail sentence imposed and stayed on the condition she comply with probation conditions and recommended treatment and counseling.  AODA and recommended treatment.   Seek and maintain employment, when agent deems it appropriate.  No contact with D.A., J. L., N.T, C. S. or the victim K.L.   CGIP per agent's recommendation.  Mental health evaluation and comply with recommendations, if agent recommends. CC including DNA surcharge.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement. Pay restitution on a monthly basis through probation.  Tremp Co. restitution to be paid first.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:Jennifeer L.; Dawn A.; Charles S.; or victims Kay & Leonard L.
